name: European Multi-channel and Online Trade Association
goal: EMOTA represents e-traders and distance sellers at European level, through its national member associations. At present, EMOTA has members in Austria, Belgium, Croatia, France, Germany, Greece, Estonia, Finland, Lithuania, Romania, Russia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Ukraine and the UK. Many legislative initiatives launched at EU level have been aiming at regulating sales over the internet and in particular, protecting consumers using the online channel for their shopping. EMOTAâ€™s main focus lies on the encouragement of e-commerce and the removal of barriers to and facilitation of cross-border sales for the benefit of e-retailers with international ambitions.
interests: Borders and Security, Business and Industry, Competition, Consumers, Culture and media, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Environment, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Transport
